Research & Classes

Here's what I'm interested in and what I'm taking now...

About

As part of the Undergraduate Research Scholars Program at UF, I have been paired with a research mentor named Kyle Fohrman, who happens to also be a Computer Science major. Besides Kyle, i have also received a lot of help from one of the student leaders in my Professional Development class, Joseph Meert, who has provided me with many resources of information for ongoing research at UF and how to become a part of that research. As part of an assignment for my Research & Creativity class, I was tasked with compiling a list of ten faculty members that I would like to do research with. This assignment opened my eyes to all of the opportunities I have as a student at UF and has inspired me to get more involved, both in research and the many clubs that this school has to offer

Research Interests

Artificial Intelligence

  • Developing computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and translation between languages

    • Machine Learning

  • Applying artificial intelligence to provide systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed

    • Relavent Coursework

    • MAC2312 (4cr) - Calculus 2 taught by Matthew Wheeler
    • COP3502 (3cr) - Programming Fundamentals 1 taught by Lisha Zhou
    • IDH1700 (1cr) - Professional Development for Engineers taught by Mark Law
    • HUM2930 (1cr) - Research and Creativity taught by Heather Spooner
    • PHY2048 (3cr) - Physics w/ Calculus 1 taught by Richard Woodard and John Yelton
    • THE2000 (3cr) - Theater Appreciation taught by Charles Mitchell
